marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Considering the large scale of the FTTH project targeted by INET - with an investment of ~3 trillion rupiah compared to the company's market cap at 2.5 trillion rupiah - execution becomes the main factor that needs attention from investors. For reference, WIFI and Remala Abadi (DATA) also have FTTH projects with targets of ~4 million homepasses and ~6 million homepasses in Java, respectively.

marketNews.title: Hal lain yang lagi hot yang perlu kamu ketahui...
marketNews.content: The Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, on Friday (26/9) stated that he did not order the state-owned bank association (Himbara) to raise the counter rate for US dollar-denominated deposits to 4% effective November 5, 2025. Purbaya added that the Governor of Bank Indonesia, Perry Warjiyo, also did not know why Himbara took this step. Himbara's move came after Purbaya said the government was preparing market-based incentives to encourage the placement of US dollar deposits domestically. However, Purbaya explained that the government is still considering these incentives for now. Purbaya also said he would not intervene in Himbara's operations, although he would "suggest the banks improve" their policies. Gold prices in the spot market rose +1.3% to 3,809 US dollars per troy ounce on Monday afternoon (29/9), after reaching 3,820 US dollars per troy ounce, which became an intraday all-time high. This increase was supported by rising demand for safe-haven assets amid uncertainty regarding the US government budget and expectations of The Fed cutting interest rates. The Director of Godrej International Ltd., Dorab Mistry, predicted that India's vegetable oil imports in 2025/2026 would increase by +4.6% YoY to 17.1 million tons, supported by CPO imports which are expected to rise by +13.4% YoY to 9.3 million tons. Previously, Mistry predicted CPO prices could rise to 5,000 ringgit per ton by the end of 2025 and 5,500 ringgit per ton in 1Q26. Mistry based these projections on the end of the CPO production cycle, the continuation of illegal palm plantation land appropriation by the Indonesian government, the plan to implement the B50 program next year, and high prices of substitute products like oilseed. The Director General of the Malaysian Palm Oil Board, Ahmad Parveez Ghulam Kadir, estimated that Malaysia's palm oil stocks at the end of 2025 would fall by -23% to 1.7 million tons from the level at the end of August 2025, as production begins to decline post-seasonal peak and potential import increases by India. Malaysia's palm oil stocks in August 2025 were the highest since December 2023. The Malaysian Palm Oil Board estimates that Malaysian palm oil exports will increase from 16.9 million tons in 2024 to 17.3 million tons in 2025, higher than the previous projection of 17 million tons. Meanwhile, Malaysian palm oil production throughout 2025 is projected not to exceed 19.5 million tons, compared to 19.3 million tons in 2024. Reuters reported that OPEC+ is highly likely to increase oil production for November 2025 by at least 137,000 barrels per day at the meeting on October 5, 2025. Reuters sources mentioned that this move would be taken by OPEC+ as the group's effort to regain market share. Previously, OPEC+ had increased the production quota by more than 2.5 million barrels per day since April 2025, equivalent to ~2.4% of global demand. The US bureau of economic analysis noted that the core Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index in the US experienced 0.2% MoM inflation in August 2025 (vs. July 2025: 0.2% MoM inflation), in line with consensus expectations. Annually, core PCE inflation reached 2.9% YoY (vs. July 2025: 2.9% YoY inflation), in line with consensus expectations and marking the highest level in the last 6 months. The core PCE index is the data viewed by The Fed to measure inflation progress against the target level of 2%. The European Union stated on Friday (26/9) that it would appeal the World Trade Organization (WTO) ruling in the case filed by Indonesia regarding countervailing duties on biodiesel. This step was taken by the European Union after the WTO panel at the end of August 2025 supported Indonesia on several of its main claims in the dispute.

tickerNews.title: INET Plans Rights Issue of Rp3.2 T for FTTH Development
tickerNews.content: Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima (INET) plans to hold a rights issue of up to 12.8 billion new shares with an exercise price of 250 rupiah per share, a 3:4 ratio, and a dilution effect of up to 57.14%. This exercise price is +9.6% higher than INET's share price as of Friday (26/9). This corporate action plan was approved at the EGM on June 12, 2025, although the exercise price was not yet known at that time. The potential funds raised from this corporate action reach approximately 3.2 trillion rupiah, with the following breakdown of use: 2.8 trillion rupiah is allocated for capital injection to a subsidiary to build a fiber-to-the-home (FTTH) network for 2 million homepasses in Bali and Lombok Islands. 213 billion rupiah for capital injection to a subsidiary for the repayment of the indefeasible right of use costs for submarine cables. 135 billion rupiah for capital injection to a subsidiary for FTTH network construction on the island of Java. The remainder is for the company's working capital. PT Abadi Kreasi Unggul Nusantara as the controlling shareholder stated it will exercise its rights and act as the standby buyer. The rights trading period runs from December 1-5, 2025. This rights issue will also be accompanied by the issuance of warrants up to approximately 3.1 billion shares with a 25:6 ratio and an exercise price of 300 rupiah. The warrant exercise period runs from June 3, 2026 to June 2, 2028. Responding to this announcement, the INET share price closed with an upper auto reject of +24.56% to the level of 284 rupiah per share. Previously, INET through several of its subsidiaries has signed several strategic agreements, with details as follows: March 25, 2025 - PT Pusat Fiber Indonesia (INET subsidiary) signed a 10-year cooperation agreement with PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem, a subsidiary of Solusi Sinergi Digital (WIFI), regarding the provision of IP Transit services. May 2, 2025 - PT Pusat Fiber Indonesia (INET subsidiary) signed a 15-year cooperation agreement with PT Jejaring Mitra Persada, a subsidiary of Ketrosden Triasmitra (KETR), regarding the provision of fiber optic core for the Batam-Singapore and Jakarta-Batam networks through an indefeasible right of use scheme. May 20, 2025 - PT Internet Anak Bangsa (INET subsidiary) entered into a 3-year cooperation agreement with PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem (WIFI subsidiary) for the construction of telecommunication infrastructure networks and supporting facilities.

tickerNews.title: BBNI 8M25: Bank Only Net Profit -6% YoY
tickerNews.content: BBNI: Bank Negara Indonesia recorded bank only net profit of 1.5 trillion rupiah in August 2025 (-10% YoY, -11% MoM). This result brought the bank only net profit for 8M25 to 13.4 trillion rupiah (-6% YoY), equivalent to 64% of the 2025F consolidation estimate by consensus (vs. 8M24: 66% realization of 2024 consolidation). The decline in net profit in August 2025 was driven by a weakening Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) which decreased by -11% YoY and -8% MoM. Meanwhile, the decline in net profit during 8M25 was caused by an increase in provision expenses (+4% YoY) and opex (+6% YoY) amid a slight decrease in Net Interest Income (-1% YoY). Credit growth stood at +8% YoY as of August 2025, in line with the 2025 guidance ranging from +8-10% YoY.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors (UNTR) to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2025
tickerNews.content: UNTR: United Tractors will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 book year amounting to approximately 2.1 trillion rupiah or 567 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of approximately 2.1% based on UNTR's share price as of Monday (29/9). The cum dividend on the regular and negotiated markets is October 7, 2025, while the payment date is October 24, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Glencore Holds 7.19% Stake in Trimegah Bangun Persada (NCKL)
tickerNews.content: NCKL: Global mining company, Glencore, is recorded to hold a 7.19% stake in Trimegah Bangun Persada, based on KSEI data as of September 25, 2025. Previously, Glencore was not listed among shareholders holding more than 5% in NCKL as of the end of August 2025. Besides NCKL, Glencore previously collaborated with the Harita group through a stake of approximately 31.68% in Cita Mineral Investindo (CITA).

tickerNews.title: HGII Awaits Waste-to-Energy Regulation Revisions, Conducting Due Diligence for Mini Hydro Power Plant Acquisition
tickerNews.content: HGII: The President Director of Hero Global Investment, Robin Sunyoto, told Katadata on Monday (29/9) that his party is still awaiting revisions to the presidential regulation concerning waste-to-energy before considering the possibility of participating in the waste-to-energy project auction from Danantara. Previously, Robin stated in mid-September 2025 that his party was considering options for expansion into the waste-to-energy sector, which is expected to strengthen the company's business portfolio. Robin also mentioned that his party is currently in the due diligence stage regarding plans to acquire a new mini-hydro power plant (PLTMH) that already has a power purchase agreement with PLN. Robin estimates that HGII can make an acquisition decision by the end of 2025.

tickerNews.title: BULL Announces Private Placement Exercise Price for Fortune Street Limited Acquisition
tickerNews.content: BULL: Buana Lintas Lautan announced that the exercise price for the private placement of approximately 1.4 billion (10%) new shares to be taken by the non-affiliated Hong Kong company, Fortune Street Limited, is 180 rupiah per share. Thus, the funds raised from this corporate action reached approximately 253.5 billion rupiah. Previously, BULL explained that the funds obtained from this corporate action would be used for business development in the form of fleet development and/or working capital increase.

tickerNews.title: EXCL Director Purchased 600,000 Shares
tickerNews.content: EXCL: The Director of XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera, Yessie Dianty Yosetya, purchased 600,000 EXCL shares at an average price of approximately 2,663 rupiah per share on September 23-24, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.6 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Yessie Dianty Yosetya's direct ownership in EXCL increased from 0.004% to 0.0073%.

tickerNews.title: Unggul Indah Cahaya (UNIC) to Distribute Interim Dividend of Rp82.4 Billion
tickerNews.content: UNIC: Unggul Indah Cahaya announced it will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 book year amounting to 82.4 billion rupiah or 215 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of approximately 2.7% as of Monday (29/9). The cum dividend on the regular and negotiated markets is October 7, 2025, while the payment is scheduled for October 21, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Outlook IHSG in the Rest of 2025: Will Mining Remain the Star?
tickerNews.content: "Mining stocks are still favorites of foreign investors, but don't FOMOâ€”the market is in a wait and see phase, so play smart." - illusix
